arm_group.description: 272 patients that underwent laparoscopic sigmoid and/or rectum resection with the indication of deep infiltrating endometriosis, in the department of Abdominal Surgery, University Hospital Leuven, between the year 1997 and September 2011.

brief_summary.textblock:
Questionnaire To assess the functional outcome in patients that underwent laparoscopic
      sigmoid and/or rectum resection.

clinical_study.brief_title: Functional Outcome in Patients That Underwent Laparoscopic Sigmoid and/or Rectum Resection

detailed_description.textblock:
A questionnaire will be sent to every patient by mail. The questionnaire that will be used
      is the COREFO questionnaire (ColoRectal Functional Outcome).

      Depending on the amount of responses, we will try to make connections between peri-operative
      data and functional outcome after considerable period of follow-up. Peri-operative factors
      include grade of endometriosis, surgical technique and post-operative complications.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients that underwent laparoscopic sigmoid and/or rectum resection with the
             indication of deep infiltrating endometriosis

        Exclusion Criteria:

        -

study_pop.textblock:
272 patients that underwent laparoscopic sigmoid and/or rectum resection with the
        indication of deep infiltrating endometriosis

clinical_study.official_title: To Assess the Functional Outcome in Patients That Underwent Laparoscopic Sigmoid and/or Rectum Resection

overall_official.affiliation: University Clinics Gasthuisberg Department of Abdominal Surgery

primary_outcome.description: Operation: between 1997 and 2011 Questionnaire to assess the colorectal function sent once in 2012

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
